Paul Potts.Action: Stands alone in the church choir, singing with great passion.
Sings with strong, confident voice in church choir despite standing alone behind others.
Appears as a vulnerable child being rushed into hospital after injury; lacks agency in this moment.
Sings passionately and fervently during solo, showing deep emotional engagement.
Sings with such volume that it causes discomfort to others around him.
Sings a solo fervently and passionately, commanding loud volume and emotion, indicating skill and confidence in singing.
Suddenly collapses after his solo, suggesting a physical breakdown despite his apparent skill.
Runs away from a group of boys who are chasing and punching him.
Looks both ways before descending steps and venturing out, narrowly avoids a lorry when cutting across a busy intersection.
Runs from a group of boys chasing and eventually losing his schoolbag to a pursuer.
Smiles when seeing the widened lead over bullies.
Does not retaliate or fight back when bullied and spat on.
Keeps singing alone in choir loft despite feeling isolated.
Veers wide to the left anticipating pursuers then cuts right to escape through a tight pedestrian opening, causing his lead to widen as pursuers crash into the wall.
Turns forward too late to avoid newly constructed scaffolding, resulting in a painful fall and physical harm.

Responds sincerely and straightforwardly about his relationship status, despite Braddon's teasing.
Apologizes politely to the drunk man who bumps into him.
Avoids confrontation and does not retaliate when provoked by the drunk men.
Keeps to himself and does not engage with the drunk men even after they insult him.
Walks home trying to avoid conflict, keeps calm when confronted by drunks, apologizes politely.
Does not escalate the confrontation, leaves the scene rather than arguing.
Does not respond to father's patronizing advice or provocation, maintains silence.
Mentions having a job and saving money for opera lessons confidently.
Responds sincerely and politely to Julz's chat messages, clarifies misunderstandings, and is careful not to offend her.
Grimaces at his own lie about difficulty getting around due to leg cast, indicating discomfort with being dishonest.
Carries multiple moving boxes up narrow stairs and sets up his workspace using boxes as a desk.
Responds to chat messages politely, manages a social interaction carefully, even though he feels awkward.

Shows lengthy text-thread on phone to demonstrate ongoing communication with girlfriend, indicating clarity and confidence in social interaction.
Suddenly darts through curtains to avoid or investigate something, displaying alertness and quick reaction.

Allows Julz to take his hand under the table, showing comfort and trust.
Corrects his mother about 'chirping,' indicating mild irritation.
Eyes fall to his lap after teasing about being 'undeveloped,' showing possible insecurity or discomfort.
Paul confidently shares information about his family background when asked, showing clear communication ability.
Paul responds to Julz’s affectionate gesture with a nod and smile/grimace, showing slight social awkwardness and lack of confidence.

Comforts Julz by taking her hand and reassuring her that the person she refers to was a 'tosser'.

Does not respond to Braddon's somewhat boastful and flirtatious behavior with arrogance or rudeness; remains polite.
Acknowledges he is not good enough to sing professionally but shows willingness to learn and perform for others.
Feels shy and uncomfortable when asked to sing spontaneously, showing lack of confidence in a social/performance setting.
Engages politely and appropriately with others, correctly identifying and responding to people he meets.
Initially stunned by the prize announcement, indicating surprise and possible underestimation of the contest competitiveness.

Shows some nervousness or embarrassment (knitting needles, being boring Julz), but recovers and maintains the conversation positively.

Pulls Julz into a kiss almost without thought but notices his own shyness and adjusts behavior accordingly.
